Class Core

  • java.lang.Object
    • Core

  • public class Core
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs most of the computations
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sam

      • Core

        Constructor
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • runGame

        public void runGame()
        "Main" method of the class. It loops until the GUI asked for closure. After each loop, the thread sleeps for 50 ms. In each loop: - The cars are moved - The collisions are processed - The rectangles to display are computed - The player position (rank) is computed - The GUI is asked to perform its update

      • manageCollisions

        public boolean manageCollisions(java.util.Vector<Car> Cars,
                                java.util.Vector<CollidableRectangle>[] vTabObstacles,
                                boolean bGameFinishing)
        Manages the collisions
        Parameters:
        Cars - The vector of cars (which are the actors of the collision)
        vObstacles - The vector of obstacles (which are passively collided). Also contains the cars
        bGameFinishing - True if the finish line has been passed
        Returns:
        True if the finish line has just been passed. False otherwise

      • findHitPlace

        public boolean[] findHitPlace(Rectangle myCar,
                              Rectangle rInter)
        Find the area of the car that is hit by the obstacle
        Parameters:
        myCar - The car that made the collision
        rInter - The intersection of the car and the obstacle
        Returns:
        The array of collided zones: +---+---+---+ | 0 | 1 | 2 | +---+---+---+ | 3 | 4 | 5 | +---+---+---+ | 6 | 7 | 8 | +---+---+---+ Note : Only the regions 0, 1, 2, 3 and 5 are computed

      • moveCars

        public void moveCars(boolean UP_P,
                     boolean DO_P,
                     boolean LE_P,
                     boolean RI_P,
                     java.util.Vector<Car> vCars)
        Moves the cars according to their speed, acceleration and key pressed for the player's car
        Parameters:
        UP_P - True if the up arrow is being pressed
        DO_P - True if the down arrow is being pressed
        LE_P - True if the left arrow is being pressed
        RI_P - True if the right arrow is being pressed
        vCars - The vector of cars to move

      • findDisplayRectangles

        public void findDisplayRectangles(java.util.Vector<Rectangle>[] vTabRoad,
                                  java.util.Vector<CollidableRectangle>[] vTabObstacles,
                                  java.util.Vector<Car> vCars,
                                  java.util.Vector<Rectangle> vDisplayRoad,
                                  java.util.Vector<Rectangle> vDisplayObstacles,
                                  java.util.Vector<Rectangle> vDisplayCars)
        Extracts the visible rectangles to display according to the player's car position and speed
        Parameters:
        vRoad - The vector of road elements
        vObstacles - The vector of obstacles
        vCars - The vector of cars
        vDisplayRoad - The vector of road elements to display (updated)
        vDisplayObstacles - The vector of collision warning rectagles (updated)
        vDisplayCars - The vector of cars to display (updated)

      • findIntersection

        public Rectangle findIntersection(Rectangle reference,
                                  Rectangle candidate)
        Finds the intersection, if any, between two rectangles
        Parameters:
        reference - The reference rectangle (which originates the collision)
        candidate - The candidate for collision (passive)
        Returns:
        The intersection between the two rectangles in relative coordinates, or null of the two rectangles don't intersect

      • generateNextRoadSegment

        public void generateNextRoadSegment(java.util.Vector<Rectangle>[] vTabRoad,
                                    java.util.Vector<CollidableRectangle>[] vTabObstacles,
                                    int iSegmentId,
                                    int offset)
        Uses the randomly selected state to generate a new road segment of size 400x400
        Parameters:
        vRoad - The vector of road elements (updated)
        vObstacles - The vector of obstacles (updated)
        iSegmentId - The id of the state that were randomly selected by the finite state machine
        offset - The offset to apply to the 400x400 segment on the y axis

      • newGrid

        public void newGrid()
        Initializes the game state (generates the road, the obstacles, the cars)
